properties.description: Subscribers will be able to run 5 calls/minute up to a maximum of 100 calls/week. No approval is required.
properties.terms:
This text defines the Terms of Use for the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) API. By creating this subscription you agree to these Terms of Use.

Abuse or excessively frequent requests to the IATI API may result in the temporary or permanent suspension of your Account's access to the API. IATI, in our sole discretion, will determine abuse or excessive usage of the API. We will make a reasonable attempt to warn you via email prior to suspension.

You may not share API tokens to exceed IATI's rate limitations.

You may not use the API to download data or Content from IATI for spamming purposes, including for the purposes of selling IATI publishers' personal information.

IATI APIs are not intended for or allowed to be used as a free web service to run your online business, e-commerce site, or any other website that is primarily directed at either facilitating commercial transactions or providing commercial software as a service (SaaS).

You will not resell or exploit any portion of the API, use of the API, or access to the API without our express written permission.

All use of the IATI API is subject to these Terms of Use and the IATI Privacy Policy (https://iatistandard.org/en/privacy-policy).

properties.description: Administrators is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Microsoft Azure subscription administrators fall into this group.
Developers is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Signed-in users fall into this group.
Guests is a built-in group. Its membership is managed by the system. Unauthenticated users visiting the developer portal fall into this group.

Subscribers have unlimited access to Public IATI APIs with high rate limits. 
IATI Technical Team approval is required.
